content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's the implementation of `clean_column` function in Julia:
```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), " ", "_"))
end
```
This function first calls the `lowercase` function on the input string to make sure all characters are in lower case. Then it calls the `replace` function with " " replaced by "_" and `strip` is used to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces. Finally, it returns the cleaned column name. 

You can use this function as follows:
```julia
col = "My Column"
clean_column(col)
```
